Package propra.imageconverter.handler

Class ArgumentHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • propra.imageconverter.handler.ArgumentHandler
  • public class ArgumentHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Argument handler handles the arguments that are passed to the ImageConverter program. This handler is used on one hand to check the passed arguments, if they are valid, and prepares on the other hand the arguments in a format, that is suitable for further processing during the conversion process.

      • setWorkMode

        public void setWorkMode​(WorkMode workMode)
        Set the WorkMode used for running the image converter (usually used for auto compression).
        Parameters:
        workMode - Work Mode to be set (so far only used for auto compression mode).

      • getEncoder

        public BaseN getEncoder()
        Returns an Encoder, that gets created based on the given decode/encode arguments. Can be a Base-32 Hex encoder, or a generic Base-N encoder with custom alphabet.
        Returns:
        encoder.

      • processArgs

        private void processArgs​(java.lang.String[] args)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Validate whether passed arguments to program ar valid. Checks on one hand for the number of arguments (which should be two) and on the other hand, if the arguments are in an expected format.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments passed to the ImageConverter program.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if arguments are invalid.

      • getUsage

        public java.lang.String getUsage()
        Get usage for ImageConverter program for users to know, how the program should be called.
        Returns:
        String that gets printed to console window and shows the two ways, the program can be called.

        Parameters:

      • processEncodeDecodeBase32

        private void processEncodeDecodeBase32​(java.lang.String arg,
                                       WorkMode workMode)
                                throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                       InvalidEncodingException
        Processes --encode-base-32 and --decode-base-32 argument
        Parameters:
        arg - String "--encode-base-32" or "--decode-base-32".
        workMode - work mode to be set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if encode/decode argument is used wrong.
        InvalidEncodingException - if the encoding to be set is invalid.

      • processEncodeDecodeBaseN

        private void processEncodeDecodeBaseN​(java.lang.String arg,
                                      WorkMode workMode)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                      InvalidEncodingException
        Processes --encode-base-n and --decode-base-n argument
        Parameters:
        arg - String "--decode-base-n" or one that starts with "--encode-base-n=", followed by the alphabet.
        workMode - work mode to be set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if encode/decode argument is used wrong.
        InvalidEncodingException - if the encoding to be set is invalid.

      • processCompression

        private void processCompression​(java.lang.String arg)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Processes --compression= argument.
        Parameters:
        arg - String that starts with "--compression=" followed by "uncompressed" or "rle.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if --compression argument is used wrong.

      • getWorkModeError

        private void getWorkModeError​(WorkMode newWorkMode,
                              java.lang.String arg)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an error based on the already set work Mode, and the other work mode, that should have been set.
        Parameters:
        newWorkMode - work mode that should have been set.
        arg - current processed argument
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - the error that should be shown.

      • validateFiles

        private void validateFiles()
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Validate given input and output file based on the identified work mode.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the files are not specified correctly for the chosen work mode.
